page.title: 04Women's Institute
page.content: Braybrooke W.I. was formed in 1957 as part of the Northamptonshire Federation affiliated to the National Federation. Membership is now 27 mostly from Braybrooke.Meetings are held monthly. Each meeting consists of discussion of Institute matters,refreshments and a speaker.Speakers subjects range from "The Future of Our Village" to "Glamour Photography".Money raising events are held for local charities.Group meetings are held quarterly in conjunction with local Institutes and Group Shows in which members compete in cookery and handicrafts.Outings to places of interest are arranged.Recently efforts have been made to update the image of W.I's in order to attract younger members.Meetings are held in the Village Hall except in July when Mrs. Underwood's garden is used.
